title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1272.3 - Operation of cutting torches and like devices restricted
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1272.3 - Operation of cutting torches and like devices restricted

State Regulations

No person shall operate an oxy-acetylene torch, electric
arc or similar flame or spark producing device on any part of the air terminal
except in areas within leased premises designated for such use by the manager, without first obtaining a cutting and welding permit from the manager. No such
permit will be issued for such operations within an aircraft hangar or within
any fuel storage area or fuel parking area, unless the work is required for the
repair and maintenance of said hangars or areas. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1272.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
